intro: Hagenbachia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hagenbachia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy underside. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
